trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem> objects, which in turn represent the data items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater> control.
To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem> objects from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater> control, use one of the following methods:
Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem> object from the collection using array notation.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
Use `foreach` (C#) or `For Each` (Visual Basic) to iterate through the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> class.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> that contains the items with which to initialize the collection.

Copies all the items from this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Array"></xref> object.

Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index.
The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> objects in the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem"></xref> objects in the collection.

Returns a <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface that can iterate through all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref>.

Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to iterate through each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection>.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.

After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

A <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref> can be modified.
This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> can be written to in all cases.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> class and is overridden to always return `false`.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> at the specified index, using array notation.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> to retrieve in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItem"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection"></xref> collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeaterItemCollection> object itself.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
